ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to analyze modern day film that is recalling / playing with midcentury work. I also learned to refine my arguments in my essay and speak critically about film.
Understood the many facets mid-century modern life better through the lens of popular culture.

I came in without a film background, so I got to learn about shot analysis and gained a film studies perspective on approaching tv, which definitely translates to casual viewing in a way that I love. 

Beyond that, we covered truly so much in the syllabus, but we learned about nostalgia, the mid-century modern, architecture, furniture, identity, various mid-century communication devices, psychology, space, and so much more!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the syllabus. The class at times was a bit dry or without structure. I wish I felt like I learned more.
It was a great class, but I would improve it by applying less emphasis on Mad Men so that the class can be more flexible with what content it focuses on.

This was an incredibly strong course! I really enjoyed pairing material that the Mad Men cast viewed with our watching of the tv show. We covered a lot of ground in this class, so I wish we couldve gotten into varied representations of the mid-century but really enjoyed what we covered! It could be improved by more collaborative and creative assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! But only if you are really engaged in the syllabus. Only take if the movies appeal to you.
If they are interested in learning about mid-century modern life and the many different ways it manifests itself in popular culture, I would highly recommend this class.
Absolutely! Such a great look into midcentury modern life, and I really enjoyed the screenings, readings, and class discussions.

extras.title: FILM 311 01 - Mad Men and Mid-Century Modern
